snippet: A new study warns that the taking of forage fish should be cut back, drastically in some areas, to prevent broader ecological destruction.
abstract: Editorial draws attention to a study done by the Lenfest Foundation that warns that the overfishing of so-called 'forage fish,' small fish that are food for larger predators, will lead to broad ecological destruction; asserts that ending overfishing of species large and small will benefit consumers and the ocean environment.
lead_paragraph: A new study warns that the taking of forage fish should be cut back, drastically in some areas, to prevent broader ecological destruction.
